private_information: This scenario concerns the first [STATEMENT] and [PLAN].

Initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_9; next object_0 object_5; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_8; next object_9 object_6; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.

Provided plan (sequence): wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1; clip object_9 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1; tightfisted object_9 object_3 object_5; sip object_9 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_7; paltry object_9 object_0 object_7.
planner_a.goal: Validate and summarize scenario A so it can be compiled into planning PDDL by the orchestrator.

private_information: This scenario concerns the second [STATEMENT]. No plan is provided.

Initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_3; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_10; next object_0 object_8; next object_1 object_6; next object_10 object_9; next object_4 object_6; next object_5 object_9; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_8; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
planner_b.goal: Validate and summarize scenario B so it can be compiled into planning PDDL by the orchestrator.

private_information: You coordinate multiple scenarios into a single planning domain suitable for the FastDownward solver.

Integrate both scenarios under one domain; create a single problem that contains both scenarios by renaming scenario B objects with a b_ prefix to avoid collisions (e.g., object_0 -> b_object_0) and build a conjunctive goal.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a consistent PDDL domain and one composite PDDL problem (for FastDownward) that captures the actions and both scenarios' initial states and goals.

public_information: Action schema paltry(?a ?b ?c): preconditions hand ?a, cats ?b, texture ?c, vase ?a ?b, next ?b ?c; effects add next ?a ?c; delete vase ?a ?b.
Action schema sip(?a ?b ?c): preconditions hand ?a, cats ?b, texture ?c, next ?a ?c, next ?b ?c; effects add vase ?a ?b; delete next ?a ?c.
Action schema clip(?a ?b ?c): preconditions hand ?a, sneeze ?b, texture ?c, next ?b ?c, next ?a ?c; effects add vase ?a ?b; delete next ?a ?c.
Action schema wretched(?a ?b ?c ?d): preconditions sneeze ?a, texture ?b, texture ?c, stupendous ?d, next ?a ?b, collect ?b ?d, collect ?c ?d; effects add next ?a ?c; delete next ?a ?b.
Action schema memory(?a ?b ?c): preconditions cats ?a, spring ?b, spring ?c, next ?a ?b; effects add next ?a ?c; delete next ?a ?b.
Action schema tightfisted(?a ?b ?c): preconditions hand ?a, sneeze ?b, texture ?c, next ?b ?c, vase ?a ?b; effects add next ?a ?c; delete vase ?a ?b.

Scenario A initial facts and goal are provided to planner_a; Scenario B initial facts and goal are provided to planner_b; orchestrator will combine them into a composite problem by renaming scenario B objects with prefix b_.
Composite goal to achieve: (and next object_9 object_7, next b_object_10 b_object_6) in the final problem.
All PDDL should be STRIPS-compatible and suitable for FastDownward.

context.system_prompt: You are Scenario A analyst. Extract the objects, list the initial facts, the goal, and the provided action sequence. Do not produce PDDL. Keep names exactly as given.
context.prompt: Summarize Scenario A using the public action semantics. Include: 1) objects referenced; 2) initial facts; 3) goal; 4) provided plan sequence for validation only; 5) any detected inconsistencies. Keep it concise and structured.

context.system_prompt: You are Scenario B analyst. Extract the objects, list the initial facts, and the goal. Do not produce PDDL.
context.prompt: Summarize Scenario B using the public action semantics. Include: 1) objects referenced; 2) initial facts; 3) goal; 4) any obvious action opportunities from preconditions, if helpful, but do not plan or emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at compiling task descriptions into PDDL for the FastDownward solver. You must output exactly one PDDL domain and one PDDL problem enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. Use STRIPS-style predicates and effects. Use only :strips (and :typing if you introduce types) and avoid numeric fluents or advanced features.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the two scenarios from context_a and context_b into a single domain and a single composite problem. 1) Build a domain named obfuscated-deceptive-logistics-6 with six actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted, each matching the public_information preconditions and effects exactly, using parameters (?a ?b ?c [and ?d for wretched]) and predicates cats, collect, hand, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, vase. 2) Build a composite problem named obfuscated-deceptive-logistics-6-composite. Objects: include all objects from Scenario A as given (object_0 ... object_10 that appear), and include all objects from Scenario B duplicated with a b_ prefix (e.g., object_0 -> b_object_0). 3) Initial state: include all Scenario A initial facts as-is; include all Scenario B initial facts after renaming each object_* to b_object_*. 4) Goal: conjunctive goal (and (next object_9 object_7) (next b_object_10 b_object_6)). 5) Ensure syntactic correctness for FastDownward. Output only the two tagged blocks: one <domain>...</domain> and one <problem>...</problem>.
